column3: Korea's Naver goes global with messaging app Line SEOUL
column4: July 7 The billionaire founder of web portal operator Naver Corp beat back Google Inc  to leave South Korea one of few countries where the U.S. search engine does not dominate.

column2: Samsung Electronics faces falling profits as succession looms SEOUL
column3: July 7 Smartphone leader Samsung Electronics Co Ltd faces a third straight quarter of profit decline that could become a fourth as cheaper models grab a bigger share of a slowing market and Apple Inc  readies the launch of its iPhone 6.

Motor racing-Revitalised Williams not settling for second place SILVERSTONE
column4: July 6 Seeking to build on their revival as a force in Formula One
column5: Williams said they were not content with a second place finish for Valtteri Bottas at the British Grand Prix on Sunday.
